notes: Subaru suspension is incredibly interchangeable. You can put WRX struts and springs on a Forester to lower it 2-3 inches and improve handling. Conversely, Forester struts on an Impreza give it a lift for rally/off-road. Top hats may need to be swapped depending on the year.

The red 4-piston front and 2-piston rear calipers from the 06-07 WRX (or JDM older models) bolt onto almost any older Subaru. A massive upgrade over the sliding calipers. Requires 16-inch or larger wheels (specifically ones that clear the calipers, like RS 6-spokes).

partName: Subaru EJ25 to EJ22 Head Swap ('Frankenstein')
notes: Putting EJ22 heads (single port exhaust) on an EJ25 block raises compression for a torquey N/A build. Conversely, putting DOHC EJ25 heads on an EJ22 block lowers compression, making it 'turbo ready' on a budget.

The STI 6-speed is bulletproof (holds 600+hp). It can be swapped into WRXs and Foresters, but requires the matching rear differential (R180), axles, driveshaft, and hubs (or hybrid axles to use R160 hubs). It's a major job but solves the 'glass transmission' issue of the 5-speed.

The 3.0L (EZ30) and 3.6L (EZ36) flat-six engines fit in the Impreza engine bay. It's tight (radiator clearance is an issue), but it's the 'Subaru Porsche' build. Requires custom wiring or a standalone ECU.
